opinions.heading: How America screwed up its messaging on masks.
opinions.description:
The US government actually had a plan to prevent almost this exact situation from happening: A written set of rules to communicating in a public health crisis, including how to make sure that public health information doesn't get mixed up with politics. But then, when the biggest health crisis in a century arrived, they ignored it completely. 

Source: Vox

topic.name: Why face masks became political in the US.

video.name: Why face masks became political in the US.mp4

opinions.heading: The new law that's testing India’s secular values.
opinions.description:
On December 11th, 2019, India’s parliament passed a new law: the Citizenship Amendment Act. 

Since the law was passed, it’s drawn widespread protests, and not only because it discriminates against Muslims. The law is also closely linked to the National Registry of Citizens, a citizenship list that could potentially leave millions of people, primarily Muslims, stateless.


Source: Vox

video.name: Delhi’s deadly riots, explained by an expert.mp4

opinions.heading: Qassem Soleimani, the man who commanded an army of militias across the Middle East.
opinions.description:
Before Qassem Soleimani was killed in a US air strike in Iraq, he was arguably Iran's second most important leader.

Soleimani didn't invent Iran's use of proxy militias; that dates back to at least 1979, when Iran's new regime looked around and found many enemies and few friends. But 40 years later, thanks in part to Soleimani's work, Iran has the advantage in the Middle East.


Source: Vox

topic.name: How Iran's Soleimani became a US target.

video.name: How Iran's Soleimani became a US target.mp4

opinions.heading: The Threat of Socialism Is Dividing Miami Cubans Ahead of the Election.
opinions.description:
Watch how Trump is weaponizing Socialism to win over some Latinos. 


Source: VICE News

topic.name: Socialism is *the* 2020 issue for Miami Cubans.

video.name: The Threat of Socialism Is Dividing Miami Cubans Ahead of the Election.mp4

opinions.heading: Is Saudi Arabia exploiting Mecca?
opinions.description:
The House of Saud gained control over Mecca in 1925, and insists that the city is a place of worship that should be free of politics. But they themselves have a long history of exploiting the pulpit for political ends.


Source: TRT World

topic.name: Exploiting the pulpit for political ends.

video.name: Is Saudi Arabia exploiting Mecca.mp4

opinions.heading: Belarus demands change, but President Lukashenko isn't listening.
opinions.description:
Defiant protesters have rallied in central Minsk against authoritarian president Alexander Lukashenko.

Demonstrations have been held in the capital and other Belarusian towns since 9 August, when an election which protesters describe as rigged granted Lukashenko a sixth term in office. Demonstrators are demanding he quit after 26 years in power, and that new elections be held.

Source: VICE

topic.name: Protesters in Belarus Are Being Jailed and Killed, But That Isn't Stopping Them.

video.name: ProtestersinBelarusAreBeingJailedandKilledButThatIsntStoppingThem-2.mp4

opinions.heading: Greece increased military activity on Meis is causing tension with Turkey..
opinions.description:
Greece is raising tensions in the Eastern Mediterranean with increased military activity on Meis. The island is the closest land mass to Turkey and should, by international agreements, remain demilitarised.

What is your take on this situation?


Source: TRT World

video.name: 2 (Tuesday) - Greece increased military activity on Meis is causing tension with Turkey..mp4

opinions.heading: Japan’s Ruling Liberal Democratic Party to choose Abe's successor.
opinions.description:
Japan is preparing to select its next prime minister. The vote follows the sudden resignation of Shinzo Abe due to declining health. The ruling Liberal Democratic Party will choose his successor on Monday.


Source: TRT World

video.name: 5 (Friday) - Japan’s Ruling Liberal Democratic Party to choose Abe's successor.mp4

opinions.heading: Bahrain joins UAE in normalising ties with Israel.
opinions.description:
Bahrain has become the second Arab Gulf nation in the span of a month to agree to normalise relations with Israel. For decades, most Arab states have boycotted Israel, insisting they'd only establish ties once the Palestinian conflict is resolved. The Bahrain deal comes after the United Arab Emirates signed a normalisation agreement with Israel last month.


Source: TRT World

video.name: 6 (Monday) - Bahrain joins UAE in normalising ties with Israel.mp4

opinions.heading: Can This Grassroots Movement Stop the Rise of the Far Right in Italy?
opinions.description:
Italians are going to the polls in seven regional elections this month. The regional elections will be a test to see if Matteo Salvini’s Far-Right League Party will take over in traditional left-leaning strongholds. 


Source: VICE News

video.name: 8 (Wednesday) - Can This Grassroots Movement Stop the Rise of the Far Right in Italy.mp4

opinions.heading: UAE, Bahrain deals with Israel make no mention of Palestinia
opinions.description:
No mention of a Palestinian state, “two states” or even a settlement freeze. The UAE and Bahrain have completely sidelined Palestinian rights in their agreements with Israel.


Source: TRT World

video.name: 6 (Monday) - UAE, Bahrain deals with Israel make no mention of Palestinian state..mp4

opinions.heading: Life Under the Bombs as Armenia and Azerbaijan Return to War
opinions.description:
Fighting between Armenia and Azerbaijan over the contested region of Nagorno-Karabakh has intensified sharply, as both sides accused the other of targeting civilian areas with missiles.


Source: VICE News

video.name: 1 (Monday) - Life Under the Bombs as Armenia and Azerbaijan Return to War.mp4

opinions.heading: Anti-government protest in Bangkok draws massive crowd.
opinions.description:
Thousands of pro-democracy protesters are rallying in the streets of Thailand's capital Bangkok to demand democratic reforms.

Authorities have warned against holding demonstrations amid fears that the coronavirus could spread rapidly among participants.


Source: DW News

video.name: 4 (Thursday) - Thailand- Anti-government protest in Bangkok draws massive crowd.mp4

opinions.heading: Azerbaijan, Armenia resume fighting, hours after cease-fire.
opinions.description:
A residential building in Azerbaijan’s second largest city was almost completely destroyed and several people were killed after fighting resumed, hours after the Armenia and Azerbaijan limited-cease-fire on Saturday.


Source: PBS NewsHour

video.name: 5 (Friday) - Azerbaijan, Armenia resume fighting, hours after cease-fire.mp4

opinions.heading: Israel normalisation deals may lead to the Al Aqsa division.
opinions.description:
A clause in the UAE-Bahrain deal with Israel leaves the ‘door wide open’ to the division of the Al Aqsa Mosque compound.


Source: TRT World

video.name: 6 (Monday) - Israel normalisation deals may lead to the division of Al Aqsa.mp4

opinions.heading: Forced sterilisations in China's Uighur Muslim camps.
opinions.description:
Qelbinur Sidik, a former teacher coerced to work in China’s internment camps, speaks about her forced sterilisation at the age of 50, under a government campaign to suppress birth rates of women from Muslim minorities.



Source: The Guardian

video.name: 1 (Monday) - Forced sterilisations and life in China's Uighur Muslim internment camps.mp4

opinions.heading: North Korea parades new missile: How great is the threat?
opinions.description:
A grand parade in North Korea has left analysts concerned about the nuclear threat posed by them. The cause of their worry is a new missile, a mock-up of which was paraded during celebrations of the Workers' Party of North Korea.

Many believe the missile gives North Korea a potent bargaining chip in future negotiations with the US. That will depend on whether Trump or Biden wins the elections.

video.name: 3 (Wednesday) - North Korea parades huge new missile- How great is the threat.mp4

opinions.heading: Thousands in Thailand Defy Protest Ban.
opinions.description:
Thousands of people in Thailand are taking to the streets in defiance of a government protest ban amid outcries against alleged corruption.



Source: NowThis News

video.name: 4 (Thursday) - Thousands in Thailand Defy Protest Ban.mp4

opinions.heading: Egyptian protesters call on Sisi to step down.
opinions.description:
Anti-government protesters are taking to the streets in Egypt, calling on President Sisi to step down.

What are your thoughts on this situation?



Source: TRT World

video.name: 5 (Friday) - Egyptian protesters call on Sisi to step down.mp4

opinions.heading: Opposition leader claims victory in presidential election.
opinions.description:
Official results are not out yet but the opposition candidate has declared himself the winner. For day's Cellou Dalein Diallos supporters have been involved in clashes with security forces. Opposition supporters are deeply suspicious about the fairness of the poll, although the government  - and election observers say it was fair.


Source: DW News

video.name: 7 (Tuesday) - Tensions high in Guinea_ Opposition leader claims victory in presidential election.mp4

opinions.heading: Thai opposition party calls for PM to resign amid protests.
opinions.description:
Thailand's largest opposition party has called for Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha to resign at the start of a special parliamentary debate on ongoing widespread protests. The Prime Minister called the session in a bid to end months of demonstrations. The student-led groups are demanding a new constitution and reforms to curb the powers of the monarchy. 



Source: DW News

video.name: 1 (Monday) - Thai opposition party calls for PM to resign amid protests.mov

opinions.heading: Violent protests erupt in Italy over coronavirus restriction
opinions.description:
Italy has been hit by a wave of protests against a new round of government restrictions aimed at containing the coronavirus.

The unrest comes after Italian authorities ordered bars and restaurants to shut at 6pm - and closed theaters, cinemas and gyms for a month. Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte is now promising new financial aid to try and calm the tensions.



Source: DW News

video.name: 4 (Thursday) - Violent protests erupt in Italy over coronavirus restrictions.mov

opinions.heading: Palestinians not too hopeful about US policy under Biden.
opinions.description:
Joe Biden's victory in the US presidential election has evoked mixed responses among Palestinians. While some are hopeful, others are sceptical. For them, Biden and Trump are the same.



Source: TRT World

video.name: 8 (Wednesday) - Palestinians not too hopeful about US policy under Biden.mov

opinions.heading: What UAE’s soldiers do to achieve Abu Dhabi’s policy goals.
opinions.description:
The UAE has relied on foreign labour to take up almost every job in the country. And now you can add mercenaries to that list. But what exactly do these private soldiers do to achieve Abu Dhabi’s foreign policy goals?



Source: TRT World

video.name: 9 (Thirsday) - The UAE’s Hired Guns.mov

opinions.heading: China gives $2.1 billion in debt relief: What's the catch?
opinions.description:
China has emerged as a major lender to emerging-market economies, especially those in sub-Saharan Africa. As part of its trillion-dollar Belt and Road Initiative, China has financed large infrastructure projects throughout Africa that critics say have left many poor countries overloaded with debt.

What do you think is their strategy with this?



Source: DW News

video.name: 1 (Monday) - China gives $2.1 billion in debt relief_ What's the catch?.mov

opinions.heading: President Maduro declares victory after opposition boycott.
opinions.description:
Venezuela's president, Nicolas Maduro, has claimed a sweeping victory in an election which was mostly boycotted by the opposition. Maduro's alliance has taken back control of the only state institution which was not controlled by his socialist party. The opposition says with only 31 percent voter turnout, it's hardly a mandate.



Source: TRT World

video.name: 5 (Friday) - President Maduro declares victory after opposition boycott.mov

opinions.heading: China and Pakistan Are Ganging Up on India in Border Dispute
opinions.description:
Civilians are now caught in the middle of India and Pakistan's border dispute.
What are your thoughts about this situation? Should other countries or organizations intervene?



Source: VICE News

video.name: 7 (Tuesday) - China and Pakistan Are Ganging Up on India in Border Dispute.mov

opinions.heading: What’s behind the trade dispute between China and Australia.
opinions.description:
Relations between China and Australia have been deteriorating recently, now tensions are about to reach a next level. Beijing recently imposed tariffs up to 200 percent on Australian wine imports - claiming Shiraz, Chardonnay and others have been illegally subsidized by the government. Australian producers are appalled - no-where do they sell nearly as much as in China.



Source: DW News

video.name: 9 (Thursday) - What’s behind the growing trade dispute between China and Australia | DW News.mov

opinions.heading: South Korea accuses China of cultural appropriation.
opinions.description:
Kimchi is a source of cultural pride for Koreans. But now China claims to have received an ISO certification for the pickled cabbage, leading South Korea's Ministry of Agriculture to issue a clarification that Kimchi is not the same as China's pao cai.

What is your take on this?



Source: DW News

video.name: 2 (Tuesday) - Kimchi clash_ South Korea accuses China of cultural and culinary appropriation.mov

opinions.heading: US-China trade deficit skyrockets.
opinions.description:
US President Trump is on his way out, and as his successor prepares to take over, experts are wondering what will remain of Trump's policies. Especially the US' trade with China. Central to Trump's 'America First' approach were policies to reduce the US's trade deficit with China.

Do you think there will be new policies or the new government will keep the same approach?



Source: DW News

video.name: 5 (Friday) - US-China trade deficit skyrockets.mov

opinions.heading: UN 'alarmed' over plight of Eritreans caught up in Ethiopia.
opinions.description:
The UN says it's alarmed about the plight of Eritrean civilians caught up in the conflict in Ethiopia. The UN refugee agency says it has received reports of displaced people being killed or kidnapped and forcibly returned to Eritrea, border of Ethiopia's battle-scarred Tigray region. The first aid convoy has arrived in Tigray since fighting broke out there more than a month ago.

Source: DW News

video.name: 8 (Wednesday) - UN 'alarmed' over plight of Eritreans caught up in Ethiopia's Tigray conflict.mov

opinions.heading: Turkey rejects sanctions imposed by US over S-400 missiles.
opinions.description:
Turkey has condemned US sanctions over Ankara's S-400 purchase, calling it "unfair." It has called on Washington to rectify its "grave mistake."

What’s your take on this situation?



Source: TRT World

video.name: 1 (Monday) - Turkey rejects sanctions imposed by the US over S-400 defence missiles.mov

opinions.heading: EU unveils draft legislation curbing power of tech giants.
opinions.description:
The EU is flexing its muscles against Big Tech, threatening to break-up companies that continue to engage in anti-competitive behaviour. EU regulators are also looking to crack down on abusive SM content with two new bills that would empower them to impose fines. The new laws could pose the biggest challenge to the unbridled rise of tech firms.

What’s your take on this?



Source: TRT World

topic.name: EU Draft Legislation against Big Tech

video.name: 4 Thursday) - EU unveils draft legislation curbing power of tech giants.mov

opinions.heading: Britain officially exits EU.
opinions.description:
The Brexit saga is finally over and its repercussions will only now be felt at ports, borders and by EU and British citizens.

Do you think it was the right move for Britain?



Source: TRT World

video.name: 7 (Tuesday) - Britain officially exits EU.mov

opinions.heading: EU-China Investment deal: At what expense?
opinions.description:
The European Union has struck a controversial investment deal with China. The EU has hailed the accord  - saying it will give European companies better access to Chinese markets. But critics say those economic benefits come at the expense of human rights.

What do you think about this deal and at what expense will it come?



Source: DW News

video.name: 8 (Wednesday) - EU-China Investment deal_ At what expense?.mov
